hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with جَ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: جَبَل موسى يُعرف باِسم جَبَل سيناء
hs:item.hs:feedback: جبل سيناء or جبل موسى is one of the most religiously significant places on the Sinai Peninsula and also a tourist destination. This means, "The Mountain of Moses is known as Mount Sinai."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with an article followed by صّ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: مُنخَفَض القَطّارَة يَقَع في الصّحراء الغَربِيَّة
hs:item.hs:feedback: The southwestern part of الصحراء الغربية (the Western Sahara) has Egypt's largest governorate, /muHaafazat al-waadi al-jadeed/. This means, "The Qattara Depression is located in the western desert."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with خَ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: اكتِشاف حَقل بِترول في خَليج السّويس
hs:item.hs:feedback: بترول is a loan word meaning petroleum. The entrance of the Gulf lies atop mature oil and gas fields. This means, "Discovery of an oil field in the Gulf of Suez."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with نَ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: يَبلُغُ طول نَهر النيل في مِصر ١٥٣٠ كيلو مترا
hs:item.hs:feedback: نهر النيل is 6,650 km (4,132 mi) long and has two major tributaries: النيل الأبيض (White Nile) and النيل الأزرق (Blue Nile). This means, "The length of the Nile River in Egypt is 1,530 km."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with بُ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: توجَد بُحيرة قارون في مَدينة الفَيوم
hs:item.hs:feedback: بحيرة قارون was a freshwater lake in prehistoric times but is a saltwater lake today. This means, "Lake Qarun is in Fayoum City."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with شِ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: تُعرف شِبه جَزيرة سيناء بأرض الفَيروز
hs:item.hs:feedback: أرض الفيروز /aRD al fayRooz/ (The Land of Turquoise) is the nickname of the Sinai Peninsula where ancient Egyptians mined the mineral. This means, "The Sinai Peninsula is known as the Land of Turquoise."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with an article followed by بَ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: تَقَعُ مَدينة الغَردَقة على البَحر الأحمر
hs:item.hs:feedback: The City of Hurgada, مَدينة الغَردَقة /madeenat al-ghaRdaqa/ is the second largest city on the Red Sea and is a major tourist attraction in Egypt. This means, "The City of Hurghada is located on the Red Sea."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with قَ
hs:item.hs:feedback: Under international law, the Suez Canal قَناة السّويس may be used "in time of war as in time of peace, by every vessel of commerce or of war...." This means, "The length of the Suez Canal is 193 km."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with دِ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: دِلتا النيل تَقع في شمال مِصر
hs:item.hs:feedback: Because of its long, rich history, دِلتا النيل has many archaeological sites. This means, "The Nile Delta is located in northern Egypt."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with an article followed by بَ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: يُعتبر البَحر الأحمر المَدخل إلى المُحيط الهِنديّ
hs:item.hs:feedback: المُحيط الهِنديّ /al muHeeT al hindy/ means the Indian Ocean. This means, "The Red Sea is considered to be the entrance to the Indian Ocean."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with an article followed by سّ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: يَقَعُ السّد العالي في جَنوب مِصر
hs:item.hs:feedback: In 1958, the Soviet Union provided funding, technicians and machinery for the High Dam project. This means, "The High Dam is located in southern Egypt."

hs:item.hs:lang_en: The keyword in this sentence starts with an article followed by حُ
hs:item.hs:lang_tl: خِلاف على الحُدود بَينَ مِصر والسودان
hs:item.hs:feedback: حلايب /Halaayeb/ is a city that has been a center of a border dispute between Egypt and Sudan. This means, "Dispute on the border between Egypt and Sudan."
